alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 8:38AM CDT until October 31 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Black River near Galesville. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Friday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.5 feet on 09/23/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Most flooding deaths occur in cars. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
